answers.author: Rachel Leininger
answers.text:
Do you separate your water and sewer funds or have a unified utility fund? Yes, we have a separate water and sewer fund.  
Do you provide sewer distribution, sewage treatment or both? Neither, we act as a third party collector for Metropolitan Sewer District (MSD).  We then retain a percentage of the sewer collections prior to distributing funds to MSD.

Albany Oregon has Streets in a Special Revenue Fund, Water and Sewer in separate Enterprise Funds, and Public Works Administration/Engineering/Customer Services etc. (multi-operations admin/service entities) in an Internal Services Fund.
We operate water tratment/distribution, wastewater collection/treatment, and a small hydro generator.

answers.author: Tony Mazzucco
answers.text:
Do you separate your water and sewer funds or have a unified utility fund? We have separate funds, however our water/wastewater division is one team, so many costs/purchases are split evenly or a 75/25 split, but two funds are maintained.
Do you provide sewer distribution, sewage treatment or both?
We provide both.  Our WWTF is also equipped to handle septage from tankers and we generate around $50 annually from septic haulers who dump at our facility.

answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
In Raleigh, each department pays for its own water and sewer use (essentially paying these funds back to the city).  In my division's budget document, water and sewer are combined in one line, though occasionally, the administrative fees will be increased for sewer and not water.  Stormwater fees are given a separate line.  Water costs also include watershed fees and irrigation consumption costs.

For our Budget document, we do separate out Water and Sewer funds; however in the General Ledger they have the same Fund source, and are lumped all together.  
We provide Sewer distribution (conveyance) and wastewater treatment.

author: Gregory Stopka
text:
A city would like to know how other's organize their utility fund for their budget document.  Specifically:

Do you separate your water and sewer funds or have a unified utility fund?
Do you provide sewer distribution, sewage treatment or both?
title: Utility Fund Question
